titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Fairfield Osborn Memorial Lectures
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Faifield Osborn Memorial Lectures FA885

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-14 02:48:18 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Fairfield Osborn Memorial Lectures

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

eventgrp.event: Sir Frank Fraser Darling, "The Fertile Frontier" 23 March 1971, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (Tape available. Not in Calendar of Events).
Clifton R. Wharton, Jr., "U.S. Universities and International Development" 18 October 1972, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (Tape available. In Calendar of Events).
Maurice F. Strong, "The Environment and the New Internationalism" 18 October 1973, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (Tape available. In Calendar of Events).
John R. Stevenson, "Reflections on the Law of the Sea Negotiations" 22 April 1977, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (In Calendar of Events).
Russell W. Peterson, "Protecting and Using Our Natural Heritage: 'Let's Stop Insulting Mother Nature'" 12 November 1979, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (Tape available. In Calendar of Events).

His Royal Highness Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, "Conflicts of Interests" 1 October 1980, Avery Fisher Hall, Lincoln Center. (Booklet with printed text of lecture available; not in Calendar of Events).
Carl Djerassi, "The Bitter Pill: A Perspective on the Future of Birth Control" 2 February 1983, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (Cassette available. In Calendar of Events).
"A Fairfield Osborn Symposium. Conservation 2100" 20-23 October 1986, Caspary Auditorium, RU. (In Calendar of Events).

did.unittitle: Reprints - The Fairfield Osborn Memorial Lecture in Environmental Science. 'Conflicts of Interest' by HRH Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh

Carroll, Sean B. "Hox Genes and Williston's Law: Developmental Genetics and the Evolution of Animal Design"
